questions.question: The boy told the girl that he ........................ her hairstyle.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: She told me she ...................... to come with me.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: He said that if his parents ...................... him permission, he ...................... go abroad.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well. Would is the past form of will.

questions.question: He told me that he ......................... such a lazy boy as I was.
questions.description: A present perfect in the direct speech becomes a past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: She said that she ........................ to lock the door.
questions.description: A simple past in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: He says that he .......................... to be an astronaut.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the simple present tense, a present tense is possible in the subordinate clause depending upon the meaning.

questions.question: The mother asked the child ...................... her wet clothes.
questions.description: Imperatives are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: I reminded him that his wife .......................... for him.
She told me that she would let me know as soon as she ............................ information.
He said that he ........................ something behind the curtain.
questions.description: A simple past and a present perfect in the direct speech becomes a past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: The Jester said that Lenore knew more about the moon than they ..............................
She told me that she ...................... that book on my table the other day.
questions.description: A simple past and a present perfect in the direct speech becomes a past perfect in the indirect speech.
